lettuce.name: Lettuce

heart.reasoning: Very low in calories and sodium, zero cholesterol, provides potassium and folate for cardiovascular health. High water content supports hydration.

metabolic.reasoning: Extremely low glycemic load (0.4), minimal calories, high water content. Excellent for blood sugar management and weight control.

gut.reasoning: Provides dietary fiber (1.3g per 100g) and water for digestive health. Prebiotic properties support beneficial gut bacteria.

brain.reasoning: Contains folate (38mcg) and vitamin K for cognitive function. Hydration supports mental clarity. Low in brain-boosting omega-3s.

immunity.reasoning: Rich in vitamin A (7405 IU) and vitamin C (9.2mg) for immune function. Antioxidants combat oxidative stress.

energy.reasoning: Low calorie density provides light, sustained energy. B vitamins and iron support energy metabolism, though amounts are modest.

inflammation.reasoning: Strong anti-inflammatory score (-8). Rich in antioxidants including vitamin A, vitamin C, and polyphenols.

longevity.reasoning: Nutrient-dense with antioxidants, vitamin K, and folate. Associated with reduced chronic disease risk in epidemiological studies.

athletic.reasoning: High water content (95%) supports hydration. Provides some potassium for electrolyte balance. Low in protein and calories for recovery.

weight.reasoning: Extremely low calorie density (15 kcal/100g), high water and fiber content promote satiety. Perfect for volume eating and weight management.

preparation: Rinse thoroughly under cold water
Spin or pat dry to remove excess moisture
Use immediately or store in sealed container with paper towel

iceberg_lettuce.name: Iceberg Lettuce

heart.reasoning: Very low in calories and sodium (10mg), zero cholesterol. Provides potassium for blood pressure regulation. Lower in nutrients compared to other lettuces.

metabolic.reasoning: Extremely low glycemic load (0.5), minimal calories (14 kcal/100g). Excellent for blood sugar control and weight management.

gut.reasoning: Provides fiber (1.2g) and high water content (96%) for digestive health. Lower in prebiotic compounds than darker leafy greens.

brain.reasoning: Contains some folate (29mcg) and vitamin K. Very high water content supports hydration. Limited brain-specific nutrients.

immunity.reasoning: Provides vitamin A (502 IU) and vitamin C (2.8mg) but in lower amounts than other lettuces. Some antioxidant activity.

energy.reasoning: Minimal calorie content provides light energy. Limited B vitamins and minerals for energy metabolism. High water content supports hydration.

inflammation.reasoning: Anti-inflammatory score (-6). Contains antioxidants and phytonutrients, though less concentrated than darker greens.

longevity.reasoning: Low calorie density supports healthy weight. Contains some antioxidants and vitamin K. Less nutrient-dense than darker leafy vegetables.

athletic.reasoning: Very high water content (96%) excellent for hydration. Provides some potassium. Low in protein and energy for athletic performance.

weight.reasoning: Extremely low calorie density (14 kcal/100g), very high water content (96%), crunchy texture promotes satiety. Ideal for volume eating.

preparation: Remove outer leaves if wilted
Cut out core
Rinse leaves under cold water
Spin or pat dry before serving

kale.name: Kale

heart.reasoning: Outstanding cardiovascular benefits: high potassium (491mg), calcium, omega-3 ALA, zero cholesterol. Rich in antioxidants including quercetin and kaempferol. Low sodium.

metabolic.reasoning: Very low glycemic load (1.3), high fiber (3.6g), excellent for blood sugar control. Rich in alpha-lipoic acid. Supports insulin sensitivity.

gut.reasoning: High fiber content (3.6g) supports digestive health. Contains prebiotics and sulfur compounds. Promotes beneficial gut bacteria and digestive enzymes.

brain.reasoning: Exceptional folate (141mcg), vitamin K (704.8mcg), omega-3 ALA, and antioxidants. Supports cognitive function, neuroprotection, and mental clarity.

immunity.reasoning: Extraordinarily high in vitamin C (120mg), vitamin A (9990 IU), and vitamin E. Rich in flavonoids, carotenoids, and glucosinolates for immune defense.

energy.reasoning: Good protein content (4.3g), iron (1.47mg), B vitamins, and magnesium support energy production. Complex carbs provide sustained energy.

inflammation.reasoning: Exceptional anti-inflammatory score (-10). Rich in omega-3 ALA, vitamin K, sulforaphane, quercetin, and over 45 flavonoids with anti-inflammatory properties.

longevity.reasoning: One of the most nutrient-dense foods. Rich in sulforaphane, indole-3-carbinol, antioxidants. Associated with reduced cancer and chronic disease risk.

athletic.reasoning: High potassium for muscle function, iron for oxygen transport, protein for recovery. Nitrates support blood flow and exercise performance.

weight.reasoning: Low calorie density (49 kcal/100g), very high nutrient density, high fiber and water content. Excellent satiety and thermogenic properties.

preparation: Remove tough stems from leaves
Rinse thoroughly under cold water
Can be eaten raw, sautéed, or baked into chips
Massage raw kale with oil to reduce bitterness and improve texture

cauliflower.name: Cauliflower

heart.reasoning: Low in calories and sodium, zero cholesterol. High potassium (303mg) supports blood pressure. Sulforaphane and fiber benefit cardiovascular health.

metabolic.reasoning: Very low glycemic load (0.8), low carb (5g), high fiber (2g). Excellent for blood sugar control. Popular low-carb rice and pizza crust alternative.

gut.reasoning: Good fiber content (2g), contains glucosinolates that support gut health. Provides sulforaphane which protects gut lining. May cause gas in some individuals.

brain.reasoning: Rich in choline (needed for acetylcholine synthesis), vitamin B6, and folate (57mcg). Sulforaphane has neuroprotective properties.

immunity.reasoning: Very high in vitamin C (48.2mg - 64% DV). Rich in antioxidants including glucosinolates, beta-carotene, and quercetin. Supports immune cell function.

energy.reasoning: Provides B vitamins (B6, folate) for energy metabolism. Low calorie content provides light, sustained energy. Versatile for meal preparation.

inflammation.reasoning: Strong anti-inflammatory score (-9). Rich in sulforaphane, indoles, and other glucosinolates with potent anti-inflammatory effects.

longevity.reasoning: Cruciferous vegetable rich in sulforaphane and indole-3-carbinol. Associated with reduced cancer risk, particularly colorectal, breast, and prostate cancers.

athletic.reasoning: Good potassium for muscle function and electrolyte balance. Vitamin C supports collagen and recovery. Choline supports muscle function.

weight.reasoning: Very low calorie density (25 kcal/100g), high fiber and water content (92%). Extremely versatile as low-carb substitute. Excellent satiety.

preparation: Remove leaves and cut into florets
Can be roasted, steamed, riced, or mashed
Rinse before cooking
Avoid overcooking to preserve nutrients and prevent mushiness

zucchini.name: Zucchini

heart.reasoning: Very low in calories and sodium (8mg), zero cholesterol. Good potassium (261mg) for blood pressure. Pectin fiber supports cholesterol reduction.

metabolic.reasoning: Extremely low glycemic load (0.5), very low carb (3.1g), minimal calories (17). Excellent for blood sugar control and diabetes management.

gut.reasoning: Provides fiber (1g) and very high water content (95%). Contains pectin and cellulose for digestive health. Gentle on the digestive system.

brain.reasoning: Contains vitamin B6 (0.16mg), folate (24mcg), and antioxidants including lutein and zeaxanthin. Supports cognitive function and neuroprotection.

immunity.reasoning: Good source of vitamin C (17.9mg), vitamin A (200 IU), and antioxidants. Supports immune cell function and antioxidant defense.

energy.reasoning: Provides B vitamins (B6, folate) and magnesium for energy metabolism. Low calorie content provides light energy. High water content supports hydration.

inflammation.reasoning: Anti-inflammatory score (-7). Contains carotenoids (lutein, zeaxanthin), vitamin C, and polyphenols with anti-inflammatory properties.

longevity.reasoning: Nutrient-dense with antioxidants including carotenoids and vitamin C. Low calorie density supports healthy weight. Associated with reduced chronic disease risk.

athletic.reasoning: Very high water content (95%) excellent for hydration. Good potassium for muscle function. Low in protein but versatile for athlete meal prep.

weight.reasoning: Extremely low calorie density (17 kcal/100g), very high water content (95%), versatile as pasta alternative (zoodles). Outstanding for volume eating.

preparation: Rinse under cold water
Can be spiralized into noodles, sliced, diced, or grated
Can be eaten raw or cooked (sautéed, grilled, roasted, baked)
No need to peel unless skin is tough

courgette.name: Courgette

heart.reasoning: Very low in calories and sodium (8mg), zero cholesterol. Good potassium (261mg) for blood pressure. Pectin fiber supports cholesterol reduction.

metabolic.reasoning: Extremely low glycemic load (0.5), very low carb (3.1g), minimal calories (17). Excellent for blood sugar control and diabetes management.

gut.reasoning: Provides fiber (1g) and very high water content (95%). Contains pectin and cellulose for digestive health. Gentle on the digestive system.

brain.reasoning: Contains vitamin B6 (0.16mg), folate (24mcg), and antioxidants including lutein and zeaxanthin. Supports cognitive function and neuroprotection.

immunity.reasoning: Good source of vitamin C (17.9mg), vitamin A (200 IU), and antioxidants. Supports immune cell function and antioxidant defense.

energy.reasoning: Provides B vitamins (B6, folate) and magnesium for energy metabolism. Low calorie content provides light energy. High water content supports hydration.

inflammation.reasoning: Anti-inflammatory score (-7). Contains carotenoids (lutein, zeaxanthin), vitamin C, and polyphenols with anti-inflammatory properties.

longevity.reasoning: Nutrient-dense with antioxidants including carotenoids and vitamin C. Low calorie density supports healthy weight. Associated with reduced chronic disease risk.

athletic.reasoning: Very high water content (95%) excellent for hydration. Good potassium for muscle function. Low in protein but versatile for athlete meal prep.

weight.reasoning: Extremely low calorie density (17 kcal/100g), very high water content (95%), versatile as pasta alternative (courgetti). Outstanding for volume eating.

preparation: Rinse under cold water
Can be spiralized into noodles (courgetti), sliced, diced, or grated
Can be eaten raw or cooked (sautéed, grilled, roasted, baked)
No need to peel unless skin is tough
